alert.note: Alert for Caddo; De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 3:53PM CST until January 30 at 11:47PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake affecting Caddo and De Soto Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Bayou At Wallace Lake. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 151.0 feet, High water will overflow and result in some significant flooding on some secondary roadways around the Southern Kingston Road area. Livestock near the lake should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 150.3 feet. - Forecast...The lake is forecast to rise to 152 feet by tomorrow. Rainfall this week will cause additional rises with a crest of 156 feet by Sunday Night. - Flood stage is 151.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 150.1 feet on 01/12/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
